rows.label: qst200208_msg0001
rows.name:
For some reason when I see that
passionate look in your eyes,
it reminds me of my husband...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0002
rows.name: Where is your husband now?

rows.label: qst200208_msg0003
rows.name:
Oh, he went out to war a long
while back. Got himself killed.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0004
rows.name:
All he left behind for me and Harghal
was a pile of debt.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0005
rows.name:
And I've always been sickly, so I
can't do much in the way of work.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0006
rows.name:
So naturally we struggled to get by,
and the debts just kept piling up.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0007
rows.name:
It can't be easy raising a kid on your
own, even without all that debt.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0008
rows.name:
Then to make things worse, Harghal
started saying she wanted to be a
dancer instead of finding a proper job!

rows.label: qst200208_msg0009
rows.name:
We wound up quarreling pretty
much every day over that.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0010
rows.name:
In the end, she got so sick of our
life of poverty, she gave up on me
and just left home entirely.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0011
rows.name:
And that's how she became one
of Bahn's dancing girls...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0043
rows.name:
In the end, apparently she did
pretty well for herself.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0012
rows.name:
She even sent money home every
month for my medical bills.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0013
rows.name: Not that I did anything to deserve it...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0014
rows.name:
I was never a good mother to her.
I couldn't even support her when
she tried to follow her dream.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0015
rows.name:
I was so ashamed of myself for
failing to make my daughter happy,
I could hardly bear it.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0016
rows.name:
Deep down, all I ever wanted was for
her to be happy. I wanted her to be
able to dance to her heart's content.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0017
rows.name:
But I was never anything but a
hindrance to her. With me around,
happiness was always out of her reach.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0018
rows.name:
Sometimes I wonder if she'd be better
off if I weren't around any more...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0019
rows.name: You idiot!

rows.label: qst200208_msg0020
rows.name:
You really think your daughter would
be happy if you threw your life away?

rows.label: qst200208_msg0021
rows.name:
You're her mother, for crying out loud!
The only family she has!

rows.label: qst200208_msg0022
rows.name:
You're the only person in this world
who can look after her!

rows.label: qst200208_msg0023
rows.name: If you really care about your daughter...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0024
rows.name:
Isn't it your job to watch over her
and make a life together with her
as best you can?

rows.label: qst200208_msg0025
rows.name:
Yes...you're right, of course.
I'm just setting a bad example for her,
being so weak.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0026
rows.name:
Really, I should be the one standing
by her side no matter what.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0027
rows.name:
If she ever comes home, I want
to give her a proper apology.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0028
rows.name:
And I'll ask her if she'd like to
stay here and live together again.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0029
rows.name: That's more like it.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0030
rows.name:
Oh, yes, that reminds me...
I haven't seen Harghal in a long time,
but she did send a letter recently.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0031
rows.name: A letter?

rows.label: qst200208_msg0032
rows.name:
"I have a big deal going down in the
Old City of Teddim. Soon I'll have a
large sum of money."

rows.label: qst200208_msg0033
rows.name:
"Once I have the cash, I'll come home."
That's what it said.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0034
rows.name:
But I haven't heard anything since,
so I don't know what happened...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0035
rows.name: That's a bit worrying...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0036
rows.name:
Listen... I know it's not my place
to ask this, but...

rows.label: qst200208_msg0037
rows.name:
If my daughter's doing anything dodgy,
could you set her straight for me?

rows.label: qst200208_msg0038
rows.name: Of course. I'll do whatever I can!

rows.label: qst200208_msg0039
rows.name:
If my burning heart of justice can't
set your daughter on the straight and
narrow, nothing can!

rows.label: qst200208_msg0040
rows.name:
Right. Let's head to the Old City of
Teddim and find this Harghal girl.

rows.label: qst200208_msg0041
rows.name: Don't be too harsh on her, all right?

rows.label: qst200208_msg0042
rows.name:
I told you, I don't know or care where
that hussy might be! Now scram!
